fields.description: Customer Invoice Adjustment ID.  This is the Customer Invoice Adjustment unique identifier

Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the transaction is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the transaction will be submitted, otherwise the transaction is saved in draft.
Set to True to disable editing and canceling the invoice inside the Workday application.   Invoice can only be updated from the web service.

If adding a new invoice, then make the Invoice Number the same value as Reference ID. If updating an existing invoice, then make it the same value as the Reference ID of that invoice. If you do not make the Invoice Number the same as Reference ID, then duplicate Invoice Numbers for different invoices may be created. The Reference ID is the only value checked as a unique identifier. Note that the name of the Reference ID is different for each invoice type: e.g. Supplier Invoice ID, Supplier Invoice Adjustment ID, Customer Invoice Adjustment ID, and Customer Invoice ID.
- The associated invoice adjustment is in approved status.

Boolean flag for Increase Amount Due.  In most cases, adjustments are used to decrease the amount due to the customer, in which case they are called credit memos.  However, there are some circumstances where an adjustment is needed to increase the amount due.  In this case, set this value.

Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

Pre-notification Sent Date. This information is for outbound purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.
Customer Invoice Line Data.  A Customer Invoice may have multiple lines.

Tax data based on tax authority and tax code. For customer invoice documents and cash sales, tax data is calculated based on line data, regardless of Tax Rate Application Data. For purchase orders, customer invoice documents, and ad hoc payments, this web service saves data from Tax Rate Application Data. When Tax Rate Application Data is empty, tax is calculated based on line data.

Withholding tax data based on tax authority and withholding tax code. For customer invoice documents and cash sales, tax data is always calculated based on line data, regardless of Tax Rate Application Data. For purchase orders and customer invoice documents, this web service saves data from Tax Rate Application Data. When Tax Rate Application Data is empty, tax is calculated based on line data.
Sum of all attachments
Sum of attachments that have the Provide to Customer flag set to yes.
Sum of attachments that have the Print With Flag flag set to yes.

This element provides all data related to attachments including, attachment file name, comment, provide to customer, print with customer, customer invoice line reference and expense report/item reference

Includes Notes that have been made for a business object. On a Get operation, all existing Notes will be populated. On a Put or Submit operation, any note information on the request will be added as new notes. Existing notes cannot be updated on a Put or Submit request.

When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.
When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically skipped (if it is defined as "skippable" within the business process definition).

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step. If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.
Free form comment regarding the business process.

Discard_On_Exit_Validation_Error.description: Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step. If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Dispute_Amount.description: The amount the Customer Invoice Adjustment dispute is over. It is optional.

Dispute_Date.description: The date the Customer Invoice Adjustment is put into dispute. If this field is populated when updating an existing invoice, the invoice adjustment will be put into dispute.

Dispute_Reason_Reference.description: The reason the Customer Invoice Adjustment was put into dispute. It is optional.

Document_Link.description: Document Link for Customer Invoice Adjustment

Document_Status.description: Document Status for Customer Invoice Adjustment

Due_Date_Override.description: If a date is provided, it will override the due date that Workday automatically determines  based on the invoice date and payment terms.

Followup_Date.description: The date the Customer Invoice Adjustment should be followed up. This field is optional and populated by the user when being put into collection, dispute or on hold.

From_Date.description: Please note that 'From date' and 'To Date' in the invoice header are not used to validate any dates on the invoice lines.

Gapless_Invoice_Number.description: - The associated invoice adjustment is in approved status.

Include_Customer_Worktags.description: Include Default Customer Worktags if this flag is TRUE

Increase_Amount_Due.description: Boolean flag for Increase Amount Due.  In most cases, adjustments are used to decrease the amount due to the customer, in which case they are called credit memos.  However, there are some circumstances where an adjustment is needed to increase the amount due.  In this case, set this value.

Intercompany_Invoice_Prompt.description: Boolean that indicates that the invoice is an intercompany invoice

Invoice_Attachment_Data.description: This element provides all data related to attachments including, attachment file name, comment, provide to customer, print with customer, customer invoice line reference and expense report/item reference

Invoice_Due_Date_On_or_After_Prompt.description: Invoice Due Date On or After

Invoice_Due_Date_On_or_Before_Prompt.description: Invoice Due Date On or Before

Invoice_Number.description: If adding a new invoice, then make the Invoice Number the same value as Reference ID. If updating an existing invoice, then make it the same value as the Reference ID of that invoice. If you do not make the Invoice Number the same as Reference ID, then duplicate Invoice Numbers for different invoices may be created. The Reference ID is the only value checked as a unique identifier. Note that the name of the Reference ID is different for each invoice type: e.g. Supplier Invoice ID, Supplier Invoice Adjustment ID, Customer Invoice Adjustment ID, and Customer Invoice ID.

Invoice_Status_Reference_Document_Status.description: Reference to an existing invoice Document Status. Examples of Document Status are Approved, Canceled, Denied. Supports multiple values.

Invoice_Status_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Reference to an existing invoice Document Status. Examples of Document Status are Approved, Canceled, Denied. Supports multiple values.

Is_Excluded_from_Dunning_Letter.description: This invoice adjustment will be excluded from Print Dunning Letters if this flag is TRUE.

Locked_in_Workday.description: Set to True to disable editing and canceling the invoice inside the Workday application.   Invoice can only be updated from the web service.

Memo.description: This transaction header memo will print on the delivered transaction. It is optional freeform text

Note_Data.description: Includes Notes that have been made for a business object. On a Get operation, all existing Notes will be populated. On a Put or Submit operation, any note information on the request will be added as new notes. Existing notes cannot be updated on a Put or Submit request.

On_Hold.description: If this is set to 'TRUE' the invoice will be put on hold.

Submit.description: Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the transaction is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the transaction will be submitted, otherwise the transaction is saved in draft.

Tax_Calculation_Details.description: Text field to summarize Tax Calculation Details.

Tax_Code_Data.description: Tax data based on tax authority and tax code. For customer invoice documents and cash sales, tax data is calculated based on line data, regardless of Tax Rate Application Data. For purchase orders, customer invoice documents, and ad hoc payments, this web service saves data from Tax Rate Application Data. When Tax Rate Application Data is empty, tax is calculated based on line data.

Tax_Code_Reference_Tax_Code_ID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Tax_Code_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Tax_Code_Reference_Withholding_Tax_Code_.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

To_Date.description: Please note that 'From date' and 'To Date' in the invoice header are not used to validate any dates on the invoice lines.

Total_Printable_Attachment_Size.description: Sum of attachments that have the Print With Flag flag set to yes.

Total_Size_of_Attachments_Available_To_C.description: Sum of attachments that have the Provide to Customer flag set to yes.

Withholding_Tax_Code_Data.description: Withholding tax data based on tax authority and withholding tax code. For customer invoice documents and cash sales, tax data is always calculated based on line data, regardless of Tax Rate Application Data. For purchase orders and customer invoice documents, this web service saves data from Tax Rate Application Data. When Tax Rate Application Data is empty, tax is calculated based on line data.
